oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Diagnosis of Congenital Bovine Viral Diarrhea Infection in Beef Cow- Calf Herd from Fence-Line Contact
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Scharko, P. B.
Giles, R. C.
Vickers, M. L.
McCoy, M. H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Angus
Gelbvieh X
abortion
congenital deformities
contact
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A closed herd of 76 head of Angus and Gelbvieh X commercial cows experienced a series of late gestation abortions, congenital deformities, and weak calves in replacement heifers. History included fence-line contact with a neighboring farm from day 76 to 165 after the beginning of breeding season. The neighbor grazed feeder steers purchased from livestock markets.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2011; 147
